events.name: ARU CSNRG, OWASP Cambs & BCS  "2020 Verizon Data Breach Investigations" Webinar
events.description:
Thursday 30th July 2020 18:45 – 20:45 - Online

Hosted by the Cyber Security & Networking Research Group, Anglia Ruskin University, OWASP (Open Web Application Security Project) Cambridge Chapter & BCS Cybercrime Forensics SG.

Background

OWASP (Open Web Application Security Project is a 501(c)(3) not-for-profit worldwide charitable organization focused on improving the security of application software. Their mission is to make application security visible, so that people and organizations can make informed decisions about true application security risks.

The Cyber Security and Networking (CSN) Research Group at Anglia Ruskin University has close working strategic relationships with industry, professional bodies, law enforcement, government agencies and academia in the delivery of operationally focused applied information and application security research. We have strong international links with professional organisations such as OWASP, BCS, ISC2, IISP & the UK Cyber Security Forum amongst others.

The BCS – Chartered Institute for IT - Cybercrime Forensics Special Interest Group (SG) promotes Cybercrime Forensics and the use of Cybercrime Forensics; of relevance to computing professionals, lawyers, law enforcement officers, academics and those interested in the use of Cybercrime Forensics and the need to address cybercrime for the benefit of those groups and of the wider public.

Speaker Biographies & Abstracts

Deepinder Chhabra, Head of Security Assurance (UK&I) with Verizon Business Group, "2020 Verizon Data Breach Investigations, Digital Shadows" .

Bio: Deepinder (Deep) is Head of Security Assurance (UK&I) with Verizon Business Group in the Security Consulting and Advisory Services.
He challenges, educates and engages senior stakeholders on many critical issues related to cybersecurity and the adoption of new disruptive technologies. He encourages innovative thinking to generate actionable strategies that help business thrive in a volatile, uncertain, complex and ambiguous (VUCA) world while managing their risks.
In a career spanning thirty years, Deep has worked with many of the FTSE 500 companies organisations.

Deep is an avid speaker and has addressed several conferences and events with wide-ranging topics on Cybersecurity, Cloud Security, DBIR, GDPR, Big Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence.

Deep holds a Post Graduate Diploma in Business Management. He has received Executive Education at Harvard Business School Executive and Cranfield University. He holds various industry qualifications including CCISO, CISA, CISM, CRISC, CGEIT, CISSP, ISO/IEC 27001 Lead Auditor.

He is currently pursuing Professional Doctorate in Data Science.
Deep's voluntary roles include the President/Chair of the ISACA London Chapter.

Abstract :

Latest 2020 Verizon Data Breach Investigations Report (DBIR) was published a few days back. This comprehensive and free informative report - now in its 13th year - provides invaluable insight about cybercrime trends worldwide in a wide range of industries. One of the most respected publications in cybersecurity DBIR 2020, analyses over 150,000 incidents and provides a comprehensive report covering the incidents and breaches that met Verizon’s quality standards.
Many security leaders use the DBIR to sharpen the focus of their security efforts and to educate stakeholders who need to better understand real cyber risks.

In this session, Deepinder Chhabra (Deep) will present the key findings and highlights of the DBIR.

Provisional Agenda

18:45 - Webinar waiting lobby opens
19:00 - Presentation followed by Questions and Answers
20:00 - Closing, with virtual networking

Registration

To register for this free event, please register online:

https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/1574728658042752271

events.name: OWASP Timisoara #16 - Cloud SecOps, Bug Bounty
events.description:
Powered by OPSWAT / Address: Strada Proclamația de la Timișoara 5, Mansarda, DevPlant Cowork.

> NOTE: Due to the recent developments relating to #COVID19 in #Romania, we have to make the announcement that the #16 OWASP Timisoara Chapter meetup has officially been postponed for later this year. We will come later with more details after we will exit the emergency state in Romania and we will know the measures! This is he right decision for the safety of everyone's health. Take care!

This spring, there's a new collab in town: OWASP joins forces with OPSWAT for a special cybersecurity community gathering!
Join us on the 2nd of April for the #16 OWASP Timisoara edition to explore the latest cyber trends and to find out from experts what pushes the industry further.

> Spring sessions - Theme: Cloud SecOps, Bug Bounty and one more that will be defined

> Schedule:
18:30 - 18:40 - Introduction OWASP and OPSWAT
18:40 - 19:10 - Cloud SecOps (Secure Operations in the Public Cloud) - OPSWAT (Cosmin Dorobanțu)
19:10 - 19:40 - Working with Hackers (Bug Bounty and Responsible Disclosure Program) - VISMA (Ioana Piroska & Daniel Ilies)
19:40 - 20:10 - File Upload Security for Web Apps - OPSWAT (Petru Isfan)
20:10 - 21:00 - Networking session

Time: 18:30 to 21:00

> What to expect:

* Great contents with a strong focus on Cloud SecOps, Bug Bounty and File Upload Protection
* Demos and best practices
* Swag and giveaways

POWERED BY OPSWAT

> P.S.
Birds of a feather flock together. Make sure you don't miss the OWASP x OPSWAT spring session! Snacks and drinks are on the house!

TBD - ora 18:30
Address: DevPlant Cowork, Strada Proclamația de la Timișoara 5, Mansarda.

events.name: OWASP: CMD + CTRL Event!
events.description:
CMD+CTRL Cyber Range was a hit from our last year's event (https://www.meetup.com/OWASP-Las-Vegas-Chapter/events/263621436/) so we are doing this again!

OWASP Las Vegas and Security Innovation invite members to compete in the CMD+CTRL Cyber Range - intentionally vulnerable applications and websites that teach how to think like an attacker. Players have fun exploiting their way through hundreds of vulnerabilities while scoring points and moving up the leaderboard. Score at least 1,000 points, and you qualify for the gift raffle!

Want to start early? Prepare with courses, resources, success stories and a different
cyber range on Security Innovation’s Community Site.
Newbies - Join us to see how many vulnerabilities you can identify
Veterans - Come back to Shadow Bank and see what you missed

Register early to reserve your spot and get a sneak peek at our cheat sheets and FAQs! https://web.securityinnovation.com/owasp-las-vegas

events.name: Operationalizing OWASP SAMM for a Cloud Security Program
events.description: The security team at Snowflake used OWASP SAMM to improve both application and infrastructure security posture. A lot of effort and creativity went into applying the framework in a fast-growing operational environment. Securing Snowflake's cloud-native service also required us to cover cloud infrastructure elements that weren't obvious in the framework definition. In this talk, I will share from our experience, what worked and what didn't, and how analytics played a key role in measuring maturity with live data.

events.name: Test your skills on the CMD+CTRL Cyber Range
events.description:
Join your friends in the OWASP Oklahoma City chapter for a unique and challenging event featuring the CMD+CTRL Cyber Range on Thursday, August 27th starting at 4:00pm CT.

What is a Cyber Range?
CMD+CTRL Cyber Ranges are intentionally vulnerable applications and websites that tempt players to steal money, view their boss’s salary, buy expensive items for free, and conduct other nefarious acts. Hundreds of vulnerabilities, common to most business applications, lay waiting.

For each vulnerability you find, you’ll get points added to your score and climb the live leaderboard. Top scorers get prizes, but all players have fun!

Worried you won’t know what to do?
Don’t worry. We’ll provide cheatsheets and tips to get you quickly ramped up.

Register online at: https://web.securityinnovation.com/owasp-okc

events.name: Auckland Training Day
events.description:
We'll be hosting a one-day training event, with two classes running concurrently.

We have access to both meeting spaces in Grid/AKL's Lysaght building - the Tech Cafe space can accommodate a class of up to 20 people, while the main meeting room can support a much larger class. The Call for Training opened on 15 July, and updated information will be posted here as it's available.

The registration fee is $150.00 per person (plus EventBrite fees). We're planning to provide tea breaks and lunch as part of the registration.

Registration will be through EventBrite.

events.name: ARU CSNRG, OWASP Cambs & BCS  "2020 Verizon Data Breach Investigations" Webinar
events.description:
Thursday 30th July 2020 18:45 – 20:45 - Online

Hosted by the Cyber Security & Networking Research Group, Anglia Ruskin University, OWASP (Open Web Application Security Project) Cambridge Chapter & BCS Cybercrime Forensics SG.

Background

OWASP (Open Web Application Security Project is a 501(c)(3) not-for-profit worldwide charitable organization focused on improving the security of application software. Their mission is to make application security visible, so that people and organizations can make informed decisions about true application security risks.

The Cyber Security and Networking (CSN) Research Group at Anglia Ruskin University has close working strategic relationships with industry, professional bodies, law enforcement, government agencies and academia in the delivery of operationally focused applied information and application security research. We have strong international links with professional organisations such as OWASP, BCS, ISC2, IISP & the UK Cyber Security Forum amongst others.

The BCS – Chartered Institute for IT - Cybercrime Forensics Special Interest Group (SG) promotes Cybercrime Forensics and the use of Cybercrime Forensics; of relevance to computing professionals, lawyers, law enforcement officers, academics and those interested in the use of Cybercrime Forensics and the need to address cybercrime for the benefit of those groups and of the wider public.

Speaker Biographies & Abstracts

Deepinder Chhabra, Head of Security Assurance (UK&I) with Verizon Business Group, "2020 Verizon Data Breach Investigations, Digital Shadows" .

Bio: Deepinder (Deep) is Head of Security Assurance (UK&I) with Verizon Business Group in the Security Consulting and Advisory Services.
He challenges, educates and engages senior stakeholders on many critical issues related to cybersecurity and the adoption of new disruptive technologies. He encourages innovative thinking to generate actionable strategies that help business thrive in a volatile, uncertain, complex and ambiguous (VUCA) world while managing their risks.
In a career spanning thirty years, Deep has worked with many of the FTSE 500 companies organisations.

Deep is an avid speaker and has addressed several conferences and events with wide-ranging topics on Cybersecurity, Cloud Security, DBIR, GDPR, Big Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence.

Deep holds a Post Graduate Diploma in Business Management. He has received Executive Education at Harvard Business School Executive and Cranfield University. He holds various industry qualifications including CCISO, CISA, CISM, CRISC, CGEIT, CISSP, ISO/IEC 27001 Lead Auditor.

He is currently pursuing Professional Doctorate in Data Science.
Deep's voluntary roles include the President/Chair of the ISACA London Chapter.

Abstract :

Latest 2020 Verizon Data Breach Investigations Report (DBIR) was published a few days back. This comprehensive and free informative report - now in its 13th year - provides invaluable insight about cybercrime trends worldwide in a wide range of industries. One of the most respected publications in cybersecurity DBIR 2020, analyses over 150,000 incidents and provides a comprehensive report covering the incidents and breaches that met Verizon’s quality standards.
Many security leaders use the DBIR to sharpen the focus of their security efforts and to educate stakeholders who need to better understand real cyber risks.

In this session, Deepinder Chhabra (Deep) will present the key findings and highlights of the DBIR.

Provisional Agenda

18:45 - Webinar waiting lobby opens
19:00 - Presentation followed by Questions and Answers
20:00 - Closing, with virtual networking

Registration

To register for this free event, please register online:

https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/1574728658042752271

events.name: OWASP Timisoara #16 - Cloud SecOps, Bug Bounty
events.description:
Powered by OPSWAT / Address: Strada Proclamația de la Timișoara 5, Mansarda, DevPlant Cowork.

> NOTE: Due to the recent developments relating to #COVID19 in #Romania, we have to make the announcement that the #16 OWASP Timisoara Chapter meetup has officially been postponed for later this year. We will come later with more details after we will exit the emergency state in Romania and we will know the measures! This is he right decision for the safety of everyone's health. Take care!

This spring, there's a new collab in town: OWASP joins forces with OPSWAT for a special cybersecurity community gathering!
Join us on the 2nd of April for the #16 OWASP Timisoara edition to explore the latest cyber trends and to find out from experts what pushes the industry further.

> Spring sessions - Theme: Cloud SecOps, Bug Bounty and one more that will be defined

> Schedule:
18:30 - 18:40 - Introduction OWASP and OPSWAT
18:40 - 19:10 - Cloud SecOps (Secure Operations in the Public Cloud) - OPSWAT (Cosmin Dorobanțu)
19:10 - 19:40 - Working with Hackers (Bug Bounty and Responsible Disclosure Program) - VISMA (Ioana Piroska & Daniel Ilies)
19:40 - 20:10 - File Upload Security for Web Apps - OPSWAT (Petru Isfan)
20:10 - 21:00 - Networking session

Time: 18:30 to 21:00

> What to expect:

* Great contents with a strong focus on Cloud SecOps, Bug Bounty and File Upload Protection
* Demos and best practices
* Swag and giveaways

POWERED BY OPSWAT

> P.S.
Birds of a feather flock together. Make sure you don't miss the OWASP x OPSWAT spring session! Snacks and drinks are on the house!

TBD - ora 18:30
Address: DevPlant Cowork, Strada Proclamația de la Timișoara 5, Mansarda.

A lot of effort and creativity went into applying the framework in a fast-growing operational environment. Securing Snowflake's cloud-native service also required us to cover cloud infrastructure elements that weren't obvious in the framework definition. In this talk, I will share from our experience, what worked and what didn't, and how analytics played a key role in measuring maturity with live data.

events.description:
As Owasp Bhopal Community we have come up with Jan-2020 Monthly meet for the Community.

There will be a one-hour session on the topic "YARA RULES 101" by Lakshya Dubey.

It will be a fully virtual meetup and the details Regarding The virtual platform will be communicated shortly.

events.name: Test your skills on the CMD+CTRL Cyber Range
events.description:
Join your friends in the OWASP Oklahoma City chapter for a unique and challenging event featuring the CMD+CTRL Cyber Range on Thursday, August 27th starting at 4:00pm CT.

What is a Cyber Range?
CMD+CTRL Cyber Ranges are intentionally vulnerable applications and websites that tempt players to steal money, view their boss’s salary, buy expensive items for free, and conduct other nefarious acts. Hundreds of vulnerabilities, common to most business applications, lay waiting.

For each vulnerability you find, you’ll get points added to your score and climb the live leaderboard. Top scorers get prizes, but all players have fun!

Worried you won’t know what to do?
Don’t worry. We’ll provide cheatsheets and tips to get you quickly ramped up.

Register online at: https://web.securityinnovation.com/owasp-okc

events.name: Auckland Training Day
events.description:
We'll be hosting a one-day training event, with two classes running concurrently.

We have access to both meeting spaces in Grid/AKL's Lysaght building - the Tech Cafe space can accommodate a class of up to 20 people, while the main meeting room can support a much larger class. The Call for Training opened on 15 July, and updated information will be posted here as it's available.

The registration fee is $150.00 per person (plus EventBrite fees). We're planning to provide tea breaks and lunch as part of the registration.

Registration will be through EventBrite.

events.name: ARU CSNRG, OWASP Cambs & BCS  "2020 Verizon Data Breach Investigations" Webinar
events.description:
Thursday 30th July 2020 18:45 – 20:45 - Online

Hosted by the Cyber Security & Networking Research Group, Anglia Ruskin University, OWASP (Open Web Application Security Project) Cambridge Chapter & BCS Cybercrime Forensics SG.

Background

OWASP (Open Web Application Security Project is a 501(c)(3) not-for-profit worldwide charitable organization focused on improving the security of application software. Their mission is to make application security visible, so that people and organizations can make informed decisions about true application security risks.

The Cyber Security and Networking (CSN) Research Group at Anglia Ruskin University has close working strategic relationships with industry, professional bodies, law enforcement, government agencies and academia in the delivery of operationally focused applied information and application security research. We have strong international links with professional organisations such as OWASP, BCS, ISC2, IISP & the UK Cyber Security Forum amongst others.

The BCS – Chartered Institute for IT - Cybercrime Forensics Special Interest Group (SG) promotes Cybercrime Forensics and the use of Cybercrime Forensics; of relevance to computing professionals, lawyers, law enforcement officers, academics and those interested in the use of Cybercrime Forensics and the need to address cybercrime for the benefit of those groups and of the wider public.

Speaker Biographies & Abstracts

Deepinder Chhabra, Head of Security Assurance (UK&I) with Verizon Business Group, "2020 Verizon Data Breach Investigations, Digital Shadows" .

Bio: Deepinder (Deep) is Head of Security Assurance (UK&I) with Verizon Business Group in the Security Consulting and Advisory Services.
He challenges, educates and engages senior stakeholders on many critical issues related to cybersecurity and the adoption of new disruptive technologies. He encourages innovative thinking to generate actionable strategies that help business thrive in a volatile, uncertain, complex and ambiguous (VUCA) world while managing their risks.
In a career spanning thirty years, Deep has worked with many of the FTSE 500 companies organisations.

Deep is an avid speaker and has addressed several conferences and events with wide-ranging topics on Cybersecurity, Cloud Security, DBIR, GDPR, Big Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence.

Deep holds a Post Graduate Diploma in Business Management. He has received Executive Education at Harvard Business School Executive and Cranfield University. He holds various industry qualifications including CCISO, CISA, CISM, CRISC, CGEIT, CISSP, ISO/IEC 27001 Lead Auditor.

He is currently pursuing Professional Doctorate in Data Science.
Deep's voluntary roles include the President/Chair of the ISACA London Chapter.

Abstract :

Latest 2020 Verizon Data Breach Investigations Report (DBIR) was published a few days back. This comprehensive and free informative report - now in its 13th year - provides invaluable insight about cybercrime trends worldwide in a wide range of industries. One of the most respected publications in cybersecurity DBIR 2020, analyses over 150,000 incidents and provides a comprehensive report covering the incidents and breaches that met Verizon’s quality standards.
Many security leaders use the DBIR to sharpen the focus of their security efforts and to educate stakeholders who need to better understand real cyber risks.

In this session, Deepinder Chhabra (Deep) will present the key findings and highlights of the DBIR.

Provisional Agenda

18:45 - Webinar waiting lobby opens
19:00 - Presentation followed by Questions and Answers
20:00 - Closing, with virtual networking

Registration

To register for this free event, please register online:

https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/1574728658042752271

events.name: OWASP Timisoara #16 - Cloud SecOps, Bug Bounty
events.description:
Powered by OPSWAT / Address: Strada Proclamația de la Timișoara 5, Mansarda, DevPlant Cowork.

> NOTE: Due to the recent developments relating to #COVID19 in #Romania, we have to make the announcement that the #16 OWASP Timisoara Chapter meetup has officially been postponed for later this year. We will come later with more details after we will exit the emergency state in Romania and we will know the measures! This is he right decision for the safety of everyone's health. Take care!

This spring, there's a new collab in town: OWASP joins forces with OPSWAT for a special cybersecurity community gathering!
Join us on the 2nd of April for the #16 OWASP Timisoara edition to explore the latest cyber trends and to find out from experts what pushes the industry further.

> Spring sessions - Theme: Cloud SecOps, Bug Bounty and one more that will be defined

> Schedule:
18:30 - 18:40 - Introduction OWASP and OPSWAT
18:40 - 19:10 - Cloud SecOps (Secure Operations in the Public Cloud) - OPSWAT (Cosmin Dorobanțu)
19:10 - 19:40 - Working with Hackers (Bug Bounty and Responsible Disclosure Program) - VISMA (Ioana Piroska & Daniel Ilies)
19:40 - 20:10 - File Upload Security for Web Apps - OPSWAT (Petru Isfan)
20:10 - 21:00 - Networking session

Time: 18:30 to 21:00

> What to expect:

* Great contents with a strong focus on Cloud SecOps, Bug Bounty and File Upload Protection
* Demos and best practices
* Swag and giveaways

POWERED BY OPSWAT

> P.S.
Birds of a feather flock together. Make sure you don't miss the OWASP x OPSWAT spring session! Snacks and drinks are on the house!

TBD - ora 18:30
Address: DevPlant Cowork, Strada Proclamația de la Timișoara 5, Mansarda.

1. Богдан Никитенко: “OWASP top 10 Mobile with the real life examples”

Всех желающих просим записаться на ивент в meetup, чтоб получить ссылочку на Zoom

events.name: Getting back into the Groove
events.description: We've been on pause during the pandemic, but I thought I'd try running a virtual meetup and see how it goes. For this first one, it'll just be a meet and greet event, let us catch up from the last six months and see if there's interest in having virtual meetings. If so, we'll get something more substantial planned for September.

events.name: OWASP Chapter POA - Encontro 003 [ONLINE]
events.description:
Buenas pessoal,

No próximo dia 30 vamos ter o nosso terceiro encontro do capítulo OWASP de Porto Alegre. Vai ser às 19:30. A inscrição deve ser feita aqui pelo Meetup.

Desta vez o assunto é Bug Bounty e vamos receber o Manoel Netto que é Mestre em Engenharia de Software pela PUC-Rio, Bug Hunter e Pentester no Hackerone.

Nos vemos lá...

events.name: OWASP: CMD + CTRL Event!
events.description:
CMD+CTRL Cyber Range was a hit from our last year's event (https://www.meetup.com/OWASP-Las-Vegas-Chapter/events/263621436/) so we are doing this again!

OWASP Las Vegas and Security Innovation invite members to compete in the CMD+CTRL Cyber Range - intentionally vulnerable applications and websites that teach how to think like an attacker. Players have fun exploiting their way through hundreds of vulnerabilities while scoring points and moving up the leaderboard. Score at least 1,000 points, and you qualify for the gift raffle!

Want to start early? Prepare with courses, resources, success stories and a different
cyber range on Security Innovation’s Community Site.
Newbies - Join us to see how many vulnerabilities you can identify
Veterans - Come back to Shadow Bank and see what you missed

Register early to reserve your spot and get a sneak peek at our cheat sheets and FAQs! https://web.securityinnovation.com/owasp-las-vegas

A lot of effort and creativity went into applying the framework in a fast-growing operational environment. Securing Snowflake's cloud-native service also required us to cover cloud infrastructure elements that weren't obvious in the framework definition. In this talk, I will share from our experience, what worked and what didn't, and how analytics played a key role in measuring maturity with live data.

events.name: Test your skills on the CMD+CTRL Cyber Range
events.description:
Join your friends in the OWASP Oklahoma City chapter for a unique and challenging event featuring the CMD+CTRL Cyber Range on Thursday, August 27th starting at 4:00pm CT.

What is a Cyber Range?
CMD+CTRL Cyber Ranges are intentionally vulnerable applications and websites that tempt players to steal money, view their boss’s salary, buy expensive items for free, and conduct other nefarious acts. Hundreds of vulnerabilities, common to most business applications, lay waiting.

For each vulnerability you find, you’ll get points added to your score and climb the live leaderboard. Top scorers get prizes, but all players have fun!

Worried you won’t know what to do?
Don’t worry. We’ll provide cheatsheets and tips to get you quickly ramped up.

Register online at: https://web.securityinnovation.com/owasp-okc

The Call for Training opened on 15 July, and updated information will be posted here as it's available.

The registration fee is $150.00 per person (plus EventBrite fees). We're planning to provide tea breaks and lunch as part of the registration.

Registration will be through EventBrite.

events.name: ARU CSNRG, OWASP Cambs & BCS  "2020 Verizon Data Breach Investigations" Webinar
events.description:
Thursday 30th July 2020 18:45 – 20:45 - Online

Hosted by the Cyber Security & Networking Research Group, Anglia Ruskin University, OWASP (Open Web Application Security Project) Cambridge Chapter & BCS Cybercrime Forensics SG.

Background

OWASP (Open Web Application Security Project is a 501(c)(3) not-for-profit worldwide charitable organization focused on improving the security of application software. Their mission is to make application security visible, so that people and organizations can make informed decisions about true application security risks.

The Cyber Security and Networking (CSN) Research Group at Anglia Ruskin University has close working strategic relationships with industry, professional bodies, law enforcement, government agencies and academia in the delivery of operationally focused applied information and application security research. We have strong international links with professional organisations such as OWASP, BCS, ISC2, IISP & the UK Cyber Security Forum amongst others.

The BCS – Chartered Institute for IT - Cybercrime Forensics Special Interest Group (SG) promotes Cybercrime Forensics and the use of Cybercrime Forensics; of relevance to computing professionals, lawyers, law enforcement officers, academics and those interested in the use of Cybercrime Forensics and the need to address cybercrime for the benefit of those groups and of the wider public.

Speaker Biographies & Abstracts

Deepinder Chhabra, Head of Security Assurance (UK&I) with Verizon Business Group, "2020 Verizon Data Breach Investigations, Digital Shadows" .

Bio: Deepinder (Deep) is Head of Security Assurance (UK&I) with Verizon Business Group in the Security Consulting and Advisory Services.
He challenges, educates and engages senior stakeholders on many critical issues related to cybersecurity and the adoption of new disruptive technologies. He encourages innovative thinking to generate actionable strategies that help business thrive in a volatile, uncertain, complex and ambiguous (VUCA) world while managing their risks.
In a career spanning thirty years, Deep has worked with many of the FTSE 500 companies organisations.

Deep is an avid speaker and has addressed several conferences and events with wide-ranging topics on Cybersecurity, Cloud Security, DBIR, GDPR, Big Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence.

Deep holds a Post Graduate Diploma in Business Management. He has received Executive Education at Harvard Business School Executive and Cranfield University. He holds various industry qualifications including CCISO, CISA, CISM, CRISC, CGEIT, CISSP, ISO/IEC 27001 Lead Auditor.

He is currently pursuing Professional Doctorate in Data Science.
Deep's voluntary roles include the President/Chair of the ISACA London Chapter.

Abstract :

Latest 2020 Verizon Data Breach Investigations Report (DBIR) was published a few days back. This comprehensive and free informative report - now in its 13th year - provides invaluable insight about cybercrime trends worldwide in a wide range of industries. One of the most respected publications in cybersecurity DBIR 2020, analyses over 150,000 incidents and provides a comprehensive report covering the incidents and breaches that met Verizon’s quality standards.
Many security leaders use the DBIR to sharpen the focus of their security efforts and to educate stakeholders who need to better understand real cyber risks.

In this session, Deepinder Chhabra (Deep) will present the key findings and highlights of the DBIR.

Provisional Agenda

18:45 - Webinar waiting lobby opens
19:00 - Presentation followed by Questions and Answers
20:00 - Closing, with virtual networking

Registration

To register for this free event, please register online:

https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/1574728658042752271

events.name: OWASP Timisoara #16 - Cloud SecOps, Bug Bounty
events.description:
Powered by OPSWAT / Address: Strada Proclamația de la Timișoara 5, Mansarda, DevPlant Cowork.

> NOTE: Due to the recent developments relating to #COVID19 in #Romania, we have to make the announcement that the #16 OWASP Timisoara Chapter meetup has officially been postponed for later this year. We will come later with more details after we will exit the emergency state in Romania and we will know the measures! This is he right decision for the safety of everyone's health. Take care!

This spring, there's a new collab in town: OWASP joins forces with OPSWAT for a special cybersecurity community gathering!
Join us on the 2nd of April for the #16 OWASP Timisoara edition to explore the latest cyber trends and to find out from experts what pushes the industry further.

> Spring sessions - Theme: Cloud SecOps, Bug Bounty and one more that will be defined

> Schedule:
18:30 - 18:40 - Introduction OWASP and OPSWAT
18:40 - 19:10 - Cloud SecOps (Secure Operations in the Public Cloud) - OPSWAT (Cosmin Dorobanțu)
19:10 - 19:40 - Working with Hackers (Bug Bounty and Responsible Disclosure Program) - VISMA (Ioana Piroska & Daniel Ilies)
19:40 - 20:10 - File Upload Security for Web Apps - OPSWAT (Petru Isfan)
20:10 - 21:00 - Networking session

Time: 18:30 to 21:00

> What to expect:

* Great contents with a strong focus on Cloud SecOps, Bug Bounty and File Upload Protection
* Demos and best practices
* Swag and giveaways

POWERED BY OPSWAT

> P.S.
Birds of a feather flock together. Make sure you don't miss the OWASP x OPSWAT spring session! Snacks and drinks are on the house!

TBD - ora 18:30
Address: DevPlant Cowork, Strada Proclamația de la Timișoara 5, Mansarda.

events.name: Getting back into the Groove
events.description: We've been on pause during the pandemic, but I thought I'd try running a virtual meetup and see how it goes. For this first one, it'll just be a meet and greet event, let us catch up from the last six months and see if there's interest in having virtual meetings. If so, we'll get something more substantial planned for September.

events.name: OWASP Chapter POA - Encontro 003 [ONLINE]
events.description:
Buenas pessoal,

No próximo dia 30 vamos ter o nosso terceiro encontro do capítulo OWASP de Porto Alegre. Vai ser às 19:30. A inscrição deve ser feita aqui pelo Meetup.

Desta vez o assunto é Bug Bounty e vamos receber o Manoel Netto que é Mestre em Engenharia de Software pela PUC-Rio, Bug Hunter e Pentester no Hackerone.

Nos vemos lá...

events.name: OWASP: CMD + CTRL Event!
events.description:
CMD+CTRL Cyber Range was a hit from our last year's event (https://www.meetup.com/OWASP-Las-Vegas-Chapter/events/263621436/) so we are doing this again!

OWASP Las Vegas and Security Innovation invite members to compete in the CMD+CTRL Cyber Range - intentionally vulnerable applications and websites that teach how to think like an attacker. Players have fun exploiting their way through hundreds of vulnerabilities while scoring points and moving up the leaderboard. Score at least 1,000 points, and you qualify for the gift raffle!

Want to start early? Prepare with courses, resources, success stories and a different
cyber range on Security Innovation’s Community Site.
Newbies - Join us to see how many vulnerabilities you can identify
Veterans - Come back to Shadow Bank and see what you missed

Register early to reserve your spot and get a sneak peek at our cheat sheets and FAQs! https://web.securityinnovation.com/owasp-las-vegas

events.name: Operationalizing OWASP SAMM for a Cloud Security Program
events.description: The security team at Snowflake used OWASP SAMM to improve both application and infrastructure security posture. A lot of effort and creativity went into applying the framework in a fast-growing operational environment. Securing Snowflake's cloud-native service also required us to cover cloud infrastructure elements that weren't obvious in the framework definition. In this talk, I will share from our experience, what worked and what didn't, and how analytics played a key role in measuring maturity with live data.

events.name: ARU CSNRG, OWASP Cambs & BCS  "2020 Verizon Data Breach Investigations" Webinar
events.description:
Thursday 30th July 2020 18:45 – 20:45 - Online

Hosted by the Cyber Security & Networking Research Group, Anglia Ruskin University, OWASP (Open Web Application Security Project) Cambridge Chapter & BCS Cybercrime Forensics SG.

Background

OWASP (Open Web Application Security Project is a 501(c)(3) not-for-profit worldwide charitable organization focused on improving the security of application software. Their mission is to make application security visible, so that people and organizations can make informed decisions about true application security risks.

The Cyber Security and Networking (CSN) Research Group at Anglia Ruskin University has close working strategic relationships with industry, professional bodies, law enforcement, government agencies and academia in the delivery of operationally focused applied information and application security research. We have strong international links with professional organisations such as OWASP, BCS, ISC2, IISP & the UK Cyber Security Forum amongst others.

The BCS – Chartered Institute for IT - Cybercrime Forensics Special Interest Group (SG) promotes Cybercrime Forensics and the use of Cybercrime Forensics; of relevance to computing professionals, lawyers, law enforcement officers, academics and those interested in the use of Cybercrime Forensics and the need to address cybercrime for the benefit of those groups and of the wider public.

Speaker Biographies & Abstracts

Deepinder Chhabra, Head of Security Assurance (UK&I) with Verizon Business Group, "2020 Verizon Data Breach Investigations, Digital Shadows" .

Bio: Deepinder (Deep) is Head of Security Assurance (UK&I) with Verizon Business Group in the Security Consulting and Advisory Services.
He challenges, educates and engages senior stakeholders on many critical issues related to cybersecurity and the adoption of new disruptive technologies. He encourages innovative thinking to generate actionable strategies that help business thrive in a volatile, uncertain, complex and ambiguous (VUCA) world while managing their risks.
In a career spanning thirty years, Deep has worked with many of the FTSE 500 companies organisations.

Deep is an avid speaker and has addressed several conferences and events with wide-ranging topics on Cybersecurity, Cloud Security, DBIR, GDPR, Big Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence.

Deep holds a Post Graduate Diploma in Business Management. He has received Executive Education at Harvard Business School Executive and Cranfield University. He holds various industry qualifications including CCISO, CISA, CISM, CRISC, CGEIT, CISSP, ISO/IEC 27001 Lead Auditor.

He is currently pursuing Professional Doctorate in Data Science.
Deep's voluntary roles include the President/Chair of the ISACA London Chapter.

Abstract :

Latest 2020 Verizon Data Breach Investigations Report (DBIR) was published a few days back. This comprehensive and free informative report - now in its 13th year - provides invaluable insight about cybercrime trends worldwide in a wide range of industries. One of the most respected publications in cybersecurity DBIR 2020, analyses over 150,000 incidents and provides a comprehensive report covering the incidents and breaches that met Verizon’s quality standards.
Many security leaders use the DBIR to sharpen the focus of their security efforts and to educate stakeholders who need to better understand real cyber risks.

In this session, Deepinder Chhabra (Deep) will present the key findings and highlights of the DBIR.

Provisional Agenda

18:45 - Webinar waiting lobby opens
19:00 - Presentation followed by Questions and Answers
20:00 - Closing, with virtual networking

Registration

To register for this free event, please register online:

https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/1574728658042752271

events.name: OWASP Timisoara #16 - Cloud SecOps, Bug Bounty
events.description:
Powered by OPSWAT / Address: Strada Proclamația de la Timișoara 5, Mansarda, DevPlant Cowork.

> NOTE: Due to the recent developments relating to #COVID19 in #Romania, we have to make the announcement that the #16 OWASP Timisoara Chapter meetup has officially been postponed for later this year. We will come later with more details after we will exit the emergency state in Romania and we will know the measures! This is he right decision for the safety of everyone's health. Take care!

This spring, there's a new collab in town: OWASP joins forces with OPSWAT for a special cybersecurity community gathering!
Join us on the 2nd of April for the #16 OWASP Timisoara edition to explore the latest cyber trends and to find out from experts what pushes the industry further.

> Spring sessions - Theme: Cloud SecOps, Bug Bounty and one more that will be defined

> Schedule:
18:30 - 18:40 - Introduction OWASP and OPSWAT
18:40 - 19:10 - Cloud SecOps (Secure Operations in the Public Cloud) - OPSWAT (Cosmin Dorobanțu)
19:10 - 19:40 - Working with Hackers (Bug Bounty and Responsible Disclosure Program) - VISMA (Ioana Piroska & Daniel Ilies)
19:40 - 20:10 - File Upload Security for Web Apps - OPSWAT (Petru Isfan)
20:10 - 21:00 - Networking session

Time: 18:30 to 21:00

> What to expect:

* Great contents with a strong focus on Cloud SecOps, Bug Bounty and File Upload Protection
* Demos and best practices
* Swag and giveaways

POWERED BY OPSWAT

> P.S.
Birds of a feather flock together. Make sure you don't miss the OWASP x OPSWAT spring session! Snacks and drinks are on the house!

TBD - ora 18:30
Address: DevPlant Cowork, Strada Proclamația de la Timișoara 5, Mansarda.

events.name: Getting back into the Groove
events.description: We've been on pause during the pandemic, but I thought I'd try running a virtual meetup and see how it goes. For this first one, it'll just be a meet and greet event, let us catch up from the last six months and see if there's interest in having virtual meetings. If so, we'll get something more substantial planned for September.

events.name: OWASP Chapter POA - Encontro 003 [ONLINE]
events.description:
Buenas pessoal,

No próximo dia 30 vamos ter o nosso terceiro encontro do capítulo OWASP de Porto Alegre. Vai ser às 19:30. A inscrição deve ser feita aqui pelo Meetup.

Desta vez o assunto é Bug Bounty e vamos receber o Manoel Netto que é Mestre em Engenharia de Software pela PUC-Rio, Bug Hunter e Pentester no Hackerone.

Nos vemos lá...

events.name: OWASP: CMD + CTRL Event!
events.description:
CMD+CTRL Cyber Range was a hit from our last year's event (https://www.meetup.com/OWASP-Las-Vegas-Chapter/events/263621436/) so we are doing this again!

OWASP Las Vegas and Security Innovation invite members to compete in the CMD+CTRL Cyber Range - intentionally vulnerable applications and websites that teach how to think like an attacker. Players have fun exploiting their way through hundreds of vulnerabilities while scoring points and moving up the leaderboard. Score at least 1,000 points, and you qualify for the gift raffle!

Want to start early? Prepare with courses, resources, success stories and a different
cyber range on Security Innovation’s Community Site.
Newbies - Join us to see how many vulnerabilities you can identify
Veterans - Come back to Shadow Bank and see what you missed

Register early to reserve your spot and get a sneak peek at our cheat sheets and FAQs! https://web.securityinnovation.com/owasp-las-vegas

events.name: Operationalizing OWASP SAMM for a Cloud Security Program
events.description: The security team at Snowflake used OWASP SAMM to improve both application and infrastructure security posture. A lot of effort and creativity went into applying the framework in a fast-growing operational environment. Securing Snowflake's cloud-native service also required us to cover cloud infrastructure elements that weren't obvious in the framework definition. In this talk, I will share from our experience, what worked and what didn't, and how analytics played a key role in measuring maturity with live data.

events.name: Test your skills on the CMD+CTRL Cyber Range
events.description:
Join your friends in the OWASP Oklahoma City chapter for a unique and challenging event featuring the CMD+CTRL Cyber Range on Thursday, August 27th starting at 4:00pm CT.

What is a Cyber Range?
CMD+CTRL Cyber Ranges are intentionally vulnerable applications and websites that tempt players to steal money, view their boss’s salary, buy expensive items for free, and conduct other nefarious acts. Hundreds of vulnerabilities, common to most business applications, lay waiting.

For each vulnerability you find, you’ll get points added to your score and climb the live leaderboard. Top scorers get prizes, but all players have fun!

Worried you won’t know what to do?
Don’t worry. We’ll provide cheatsheets and tips to get you quickly ramped up.

Register online at: https://web.securityinnovation.com/owasp-okc

events.name: ARU CSNRG, OWASP Cambs & BCS  "2020 Verizon Data Breach Investigations" Webinar
events.description:
Thursday 30th July 2020 18:45 – 20:45 - Online

Hosted by the Cyber Security & Networking Research Group, Anglia Ruskin University, OWASP (Open Web Application Security Project) Cambridge Chapter & BCS Cybercrime Forensics SG.

Background

OWASP (Open Web Application Security Project is a 501(c)(3) not-for-profit worldwide charitable organization focused on improving the security of application software. Their mission is to make application security visible, so that people and organizations can make informed decisions about true application security risks.

The Cyber Security and Networking (CSN) Research Group at Anglia Ruskin University has close working strategic relationships with industry, professional bodies, law enforcement, government agencies and academia in the delivery of operationally focused applied information and application security research. We have strong international links with professional organisations such as OWASP, BCS, ISC2, IISP & the UK Cyber Security Forum amongst others.

The BCS – Chartered Institute for IT - Cybercrime Forensics Special Interest Group (SG) promotes Cybercrime Forensics and the use of Cybercrime Forensics; of relevance to computing professionals, lawyers, law enforcement officers, academics and those interested in the use of Cybercrime Forensics and the need to address cybercrime for the benefit of those groups and of the wider public.

Speaker Biographies & Abstracts

Deepinder Chhabra, Head of Security Assurance (UK&I) with Verizon Business Group, "2020 Verizon Data Breach Investigations, Digital Shadows" .

Bio: Deepinder (Deep) is Head of Security Assurance (UK&I) with Verizon Business Group in the Security Consulting and Advisory Services.
He challenges, educates and engages senior stakeholders on many critical issues related to cybersecurity and the adoption of new disruptive technologies. He encourages innovative thinking to generate actionable strategies that help business thrive in a volatile, uncertain, complex and ambiguous (VUCA) world while managing their risks.
In a career spanning thirty years, Deep has worked with many of the FTSE 500 companies organisations.

Deep is an avid speaker and has addressed several conferences and events with wide-ranging topics on Cybersecurity, Cloud Security, DBIR, GDPR, Big Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence.

Deep holds a Post Graduate Diploma in Business Management. He has received Executive Education at Harvard Business School Executive and Cranfield University. He holds various industry qualifications including CCISO, CISA, CISM, CRISC, CGEIT, CISSP, ISO/IEC 27001 Lead Auditor.

He is currently pursuing Professional Doctorate in Data Science.
Deep's voluntary roles include the President/Chair of the ISACA London Chapter.

Abstract :

Latest 2020 Verizon Data Breach Investigations Report (DBIR) was published a few days back. This comprehensive and free informative report - now in its 13th year - provides invaluable insight about cybercrime trends worldwide in a wide range of industries. One of the most respected publications in cybersecurity DBIR 2020, analyses over 150,000 incidents and provides a comprehensive report covering the incidents and breaches that met Verizon’s quality standards.
Many security leaders use the DBIR to sharpen the focus of their security efforts and to educate stakeholders who need to better understand real cyber risks.

In this session, Deepinder Chhabra (Deep) will present the key findings and highlights of the DBIR.

Provisional Agenda

18:45 - Webinar waiting lobby opens
19:00 - Presentation followed by Questions and Answers
20:00 - Closing, with virtual networking

Registration

To register for this free event, please register online:

https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/1574728658042752271

events.name: OWASP Timisoara #16 - Cloud SecOps, Bug Bounty
events.description:
Powered by OPSWAT / Address: Strada Proclamația de la Timișoara 5, Mansarda, DevPlant Cowork.

> NOTE: Due to the recent developments relating to #COVID19 in #Romania, we have to make the announcement that the #16 OWASP Timisoara Chapter meetup has officially been postponed for later this year. We will come later with more details after we will exit the emergency state in Romania and we will know the measures! This is he right decision for the safety of everyone's health. Take care!

This spring, there's a new collab in town: OWASP joins forces with OPSWAT for a special cybersecurity community gathering!
Join us on the 2nd of April for the #16 OWASP Timisoara edition to explore the latest cyber trends and to find out from experts what pushes the industry further.

> Spring sessions - Theme: Cloud SecOps, Bug Bounty and one more that will be defined

> Schedule:
18:30 - 18:40 - Introduction OWASP and OPSWAT
18:40 - 19:10 - Cloud SecOps (Secure Operations in the Public Cloud) - OPSWAT (Cosmin Dorobanțu)
19:10 - 19:40 - Working with Hackers (Bug Bounty and Responsible Disclosure Program) - VISMA (Ioana Piroska & Daniel Ilies)
19:40 - 20:10 - File Upload Security for Web Apps - OPSWAT (Petru Isfan)
20:10 - 21:00 - Networking session

Time: 18:30 to 21:00

> What to expect:

* Great contents with a strong focus on Cloud SecOps, Bug Bounty and File Upload Protection
* Demos and best practices
* Swag and giveaways

POWERED BY OPSWAT

> P.S.
Birds of a feather flock together. Make sure you don't miss the OWASP x OPSWAT spring session! Snacks and drinks are on the house!

TBD - ora 18:30
Address: DevPlant Cowork, Strada Proclamația de la Timișoara 5, Mansarda.

events.name: Getting back into the Groove
events.description: We've been on pause during the pandemic, but I thought I'd try running a virtual meetup and see how it goes. For this first one, it'll just be a meet and greet event, let us catch up from the last six months and see if there's interest in having virtual meetings. If so, we'll get something more substantial planned for September.

events.name: OWASP Chapter POA - Encontro 003 [ONLINE]
events.description:
Buenas pessoal,

No próximo dia 30 vamos ter o nosso terceiro encontro do capítulo OWASP de Porto Alegre. Vai ser às 19:30. A inscrição deve ser feita aqui pelo Meetup.

Desta vez o assunto é Bug Bounty e vamos receber o Manoel Netto que é Mestre em Engenharia de Software pela PUC-Rio, Bug Hunter e Pentester no Hackerone.

Nos vemos lá...

events.name: OWASP: CMD + CTRL Event!
events.description:
CMD+CTRL Cyber Range was a hit from our last year's event (https://www.meetup.com/OWASP-Las-Vegas-Chapter/events/263621436/) so we are doing this again!

OWASP Las Vegas and Security Innovation invite members to compete in the CMD+CTRL Cyber Range - intentionally vulnerable applications and websites that teach how to think like an attacker. Players have fun exploiting their way through hundreds of vulnerabilities while scoring points and moving up the leaderboard. Score at least 1,000 points, and you qualify for the gift raffle!

Want to start early? Prepare with courses, resources, success stories and a different
cyber range on Security Innovation’s Community Site.
Newbies - Join us to see how many vulnerabilities you can identify
Veterans - Come back to Shadow Bank and see what you missed

Register early to reserve your spot and get a sneak peek at our cheat sheets and FAQs! https://web.securityinnovation.com/owasp-las-vegas

events.name: Operationalizing OWASP SAMM for a Cloud Security Program
events.description: The security team at Snowflake used OWASP SAMM to improve both application and infrastructure security posture. A lot of effort and creativity went into applying the framework in a fast-growing operational environment. Securing Snowflake's cloud-native service also required us to cover cloud infrastructure elements that weren't obvious in the framework definition. In this talk, I will share from our experience, what worked and what didn't, and how analytics played a key role in measuring maturity with live data.

events.name: Test your skills on the CMD+CTRL Cyber Range
events.description:
Join your friends in the OWASP Oklahoma City chapter for a unique and challenging event featuring the CMD+CTRL Cyber Range on Thursday, August 27th starting at 4:00pm CT.

What is a Cyber Range?
CMD+CTRL Cyber Ranges are intentionally vulnerable applications and websites that tempt players to steal money, view their boss’s salary, buy expensive items for free, and conduct other nefarious acts. Hundreds of vulnerabilities, common to most business applications, lay waiting.

For each vulnerability you find, you’ll get points added to your score and climb the live leaderboard. Top scorers get prizes, but all players have fun!

Worried you won’t know what to do?
Don’t worry. We’ll provide cheatsheets and tips to get you quickly ramped up.

Register online at: https://web.securityinnovation.com/owasp-okc

events.name: Auckland Training Day
events.description:
We'll be hosting a one-day training event, with two classes running concurrently.

We have access to both meeting spaces in Grid/AKL's Lysaght building - the Tech Cafe space can accommodate a class of up to 20 people, while the main meeting room can support a much larger class. The Call for Training opened on 15 July, and updated information will be posted here as it's available.

The registration fee is $150.00 per person (plus EventBrite fees). We're planning to provide tea breaks and lunch as part of the registration.

Registration will be through EventBrite.

events.name: ARU CSNRG, OWASP Cambs & BCS  "2020 Verizon Data Breach Investigations" Webinar
events.description:
Thursday 30th July 2020 18:45 – 20:45 - Online

Hosted by the Cyber Security & Networking Research Group, Anglia Ruskin University, OWASP (Open Web Application Security Project) Cambridge Chapter & BCS Cybercrime Forensics SG.

Background

OWASP (Open Web Application Security Project is a 501(c)(3) not-for-profit worldwide charitable organization focused on improving the security of application software. Their mission is to make application security visible, so that people and organizations can make informed decisions about true application security risks.

The Cyber Security and Networking (CSN) Research Group at Anglia Ruskin University has close working strategic relationships with industry, professional bodies, law enforcement, government agencies and academia in the delivery of operationally focused applied information and application security research. We have strong international links with professional organisations such as OWASP, BCS, ISC2, IISP & the UK Cyber Security Forum amongst others.

The BCS – Chartered Institute for IT - Cybercrime Forensics Special Interest Group (SG) promotes Cybercrime Forensics and the use of Cybercrime Forensics; of relevance to computing professionals, lawyers, law enforcement officers, academics and those interested in the use of Cybercrime Forensics and the need to address cybercrime for the benefit of those groups and of the wider public.

Speaker Biographies & Abstracts

Deepinder Chhabra, Head of Security Assurance (UK&I) with Verizon Business Group, "2020 Verizon Data Breach Investigations, Digital Shadows" .

Bio: Deepinder (Deep) is Head of Security Assurance (UK&I) with Verizon Business Group in the Security Consulting and Advisory Services.
He challenges, educates and engages senior stakeholders on many critical issues related to cybersecurity and the adoption of new disruptive technologies. He encourages innovative thinking to generate actionable strategies that help business thrive in a volatile, uncertain, complex and ambiguous (VUCA) world while managing their risks.
In a career spanning thirty years, Deep has worked with many of the FTSE 500 companies organisations.

Deep is an avid speaker and has addressed several conferences and events with wide-ranging topics on Cybersecurity, Cloud Security, DBIR, GDPR, Big Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence.

Deep holds a Post Graduate Diploma in Business Management. He has received Executive Education at Harvard Business School Executive and Cranfield University. He holds various industry qualifications including CCISO, CISA, CISM, CRISC, CGEIT, CISSP, ISO/IEC 27001 Lead Auditor.

He is currently pursuing Professional Doctorate in Data Science.
Deep's voluntary roles include the President/Chair of the ISACA London Chapter.

Abstract :

Latest 2020 Verizon Data Breach Investigations Report (DBIR) was published a few days back. This comprehensive and free informative report - now in its 13th year - provides invaluable insight about cybercrime trends worldwide in a wide range of industries. One of the most respected publications in cybersecurity DBIR 2020, analyses over 150,000 incidents and provides a comprehensive report covering the incidents and breaches that met Verizon’s quality standards.
Many security leaders use the DBIR to sharpen the focus of their security efforts and to educate stakeholders who need to better understand real cyber risks.

In this session, Deepinder Chhabra (Deep) will present the key findings and highlights of the DBIR.

Provisional Agenda

18:45 - Webinar waiting lobby opens
19:00 - Presentation followed by Questions and Answers
20:00 - Closing, with virtual networking

Registration

To register for this free event, please register online:

https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/1574728658042752271

events.name: OWASP Timisoara #16 - Cloud SecOps, Bug Bounty
events.description:
Powered by OPSWAT / Address: Strada Proclamația de la Timișoara 5, Mansarda, DevPlant Cowork.

> NOTE: Due to the recent developments relating to #COVID19 in #Romania, we have to make the announcement that the #16 OWASP Timisoara Chapter meetup has officially been postponed for later this year. We will come later with more details after we will exit the emergency state in Romania and we will know the measures! This is he right decision for the safety of everyone's health. Take care!

This spring, there's a new collab in town: OWASP joins forces with OPSWAT for a special cybersecurity community gathering!
Join us on the 2nd of April for the #16 OWASP Timisoara edition to explore the latest cyber trends and to find out from experts what pushes the industry further.

> Spring sessions - Theme: Cloud SecOps, Bug Bounty and one more that will be defined

> Schedule:
18:30 - 18:40 - Introduction OWASP and OPSWAT
18:40 - 19:10 - Cloud SecOps (Secure Operations in the Public Cloud) - OPSWAT (Cosmin Dorobanțu)
19:10 - 19:40 - Working with Hackers (Bug Bounty and Responsible Disclosure Program) - VISMA (Ioana Piroska & Daniel Ilies)
19:40 - 20:10 - File Upload Security for Web Apps - OPSWAT (Petru Isfan)
20:10 - 21:00 - Networking session

Time: 18:30 to 21:00

> What to expect:

* Great contents with a strong focus on Cloud SecOps, Bug Bounty and File Upload Protection
* Demos and best practices
* Swag and giveaways

POWERED BY OPSWAT

> P.S.
Birds of a feather flock together. Make sure you don't miss the OWASP x OPSWAT spring session! Snacks and drinks are on the house!

TBD - ora 18:30
Address: DevPlant Cowork, Strada Proclamația de la Timișoara 5, Mansarda.

If so, we'll get something more substantial planned for September.

events.name: OWASP: CMD + CTRL Event!
events.description:
CMD+CTRL Cyber Range was a hit from our last year's event (https://www.meetup.com/OWASP-Las-Vegas-Chapter/events/263621436/) so we are doing this again!

OWASP Las Vegas and Security Innovation invite members to compete in the CMD+CTRL Cyber Range - intentionally vulnerable applications and websites that teach how to think like an attacker. Players have fun exploiting their way through hundreds of vulnerabilities while scoring points and moving up the leaderboard. Score at least 1,000 points, and you qualify for the gift raffle!

Want to start early? Prepare with courses, resources, success stories and a different
cyber range on Security Innovation’s Community Site.
Newbies - Join us to see how many vulnerabilities you can identify
Veterans - Come back to Shadow Bank and see what you missed

Register early to reserve your spot and get a sneak peek at our cheat sheets and FAQs! https://web.securityinnovation.com/owasp-las-vegas

events.name: Operationalizing OWASP SAMM for a Cloud Security Program
events.description: The security team at Snowflake used OWASP SAMM to improve both application and infrastructure security posture. A lot of effort and creativity went into applying the framework in a fast-growing operational environment. Securing Snowflake's cloud-native service also required us to cover cloud infrastructure elements that weren't obvious in the framework definition. In this talk, I will share from our experience, what worked and what didn't, and how analytics played a key role in measuring maturity with live data.

events.name: Test your skills on the CMD+CTRL Cyber Range
events.description:
Join your friends in the OWASP Oklahoma City chapter for a unique and challenging event featuring the CMD+CTRL Cyber Range on Thursday, August 27th starting at 4:00pm CT.

What is a Cyber Range?
CMD+CTRL Cyber Ranges are intentionally vulnerable applications and websites that tempt players to steal money, view their boss’s salary, buy expensive items for free, and conduct other nefarious acts. Hundreds of vulnerabilities, common to most business applications, lay waiting.

For each vulnerability you find, you’ll get points added to your score and climb the live leaderboard. Top scorers get prizes, but all players have fun!

Worried you won’t know what to do?
Don’t worry. We’ll provide cheatsheets and tips to get you quickly ramped up.

Register online at: https://web.securityinnovation.com/owasp-okc

events.name: Auckland Training Day
events.description:
We'll be hosting a one-day training event, with two classes running concurrently.

We have access to both meeting spaces in Grid/AKL's Lysaght building - the Tech Cafe space can accommodate a class of up to 20 people, while the main meeting room can support a much larger class. The Call for Training opened on 15 July, and updated information will be posted here as it's available.

The registration fee is $150.00 per person (plus EventBrite fees). We're planning to provide tea breaks and lunch as part of the registration.

Registration will be through EventBrite.

The BCS – Chartered Institute for IT - Cybercrime Forensics Special Interest Group (SG) promotes Cybercrime Forensics and the use of Cybercrime Forensics; of relevance to computing professionals, lawyers, law enforcement officers, academics and those interested in the use of Cybercrime Forensics and the need to address cybercrime for the benefit of those groups and of the wider public.

Speaker Biographies & Abstracts

Deepinder Chhabra, Head of Security Assurance (UK&I) with Verizon Business Group, "2020 Verizon Data Breach Investigations, Digital Shadows" .

Bio: Deepinder (Deep) is Head of Security Assurance (UK&I) with Verizon Business Group in the Security Consulting and Advisory Services.
He challenges, educates and engages senior stakeholders on many critical issues related to cybersecurity and the adoption of new disruptive technologies. He encourages innovative thinking to generate actionable strategies that help business thrive in a volatile, uncertain, complex and ambiguous (VUCA) world while managing their risks.
In a career spanning thirty years, Deep has worked with many of the FTSE 500 companies organisations.

Deep is an avid speaker and has addressed several conferences and events with wide-ranging topics on Cybersecurity, Cloud Security, DBIR, GDPR, Big Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence.

Deep holds a Post Graduate Diploma in Business Management. He has received Executive Education at Harvard Business School Executive and Cranfield University. He holds various industry qualifications including CCISO, CISA, CISM, CRISC, CGEIT, CISSP, ISO/IEC 27001 Lead Auditor.

He is currently pursuing Professional Doctorate in Data Science.
Deep's voluntary roles include the President/Chair of the ISACA London Chapter.

Abstract :

Latest 2020 Verizon Data Breach Investigations Report (DBIR) was published a few days back. This comprehensive and free informative report - now in its 13th year - provides invaluable insight about cybercrime trends worldwide in a wide range of industries. One of the most respected publications in cybersecurity DBIR 2020, analyses over 150,000 incidents and provides a comprehensive report covering the incidents and breaches that met Verizon’s quality standards.
Many security leaders use the DBIR to sharpen the focus of their security efforts and to educate stakeholders who need to better understand real cyber risks.

In this session, Deepinder Chhabra (Deep) will present the key findings and highlights of the DBIR.

Provisional Agenda

18:45 - Webinar waiting lobby opens
19:00 - Presentation followed by Questions and Answers
20:00 - Closing, with virtual networking

Registration

To register for this free event, please register online:

https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/1574728658042752271

events.name: OWASP: CMD + CTRL Event!
events.description:
CMD+CTRL Cyber Range was a hit from our last year's event (https://www.meetup.com/OWASP-Las-Vegas-Chapter/events/263621436/) so we are doing this again!

OWASP Las Vegas and Security Innovation invite members to compete in the CMD+CTRL Cyber Range - intentionally vulnerable applications and websites that teach how to think like an attacker. Players have fun exploiting their way through hundreds of vulnerabilities while scoring points and moving up the leaderboard. Score at least 1,000 points, and you qualify for the gift raffle!

Want to start early? Prepare with courses, resources, success stories and a different
cyber range on Security Innovation’s Community Site.
Newbies - Join us to see how many vulnerabilities you can identify
Veterans - Come back to Shadow Bank and see what you missed

Register early to reserve your spot and get a sneak peek at our cheat sheets and FAQs! https://web.securityinnovation.com/owasp-las-vegas

events.name: Operationalizing OWASP SAMM for a Cloud Security Program
events.description: The security team at Snowflake used OWASP SAMM to improve both application and infrastructure security posture. A lot of effort and creativity went into applying the framework in a fast-growing operational environment. Securing Snowflake's cloud-native service also required us to cover cloud infrastructure elements that weren't obvious in the framework definition. In this talk, I will share from our experience, what worked and what didn't, and how analytics played a key role in measuring maturity with live data.

events.name: Test your skills on the CMD+CTRL Cyber Range
events.description:
Join your friends in the OWASP Oklahoma City chapter for a unique and challenging event featuring the CMD+CTRL Cyber Range on Thursday, August 27th starting at 4:00pm CT.

What is a Cyber Range?
CMD+CTRL Cyber Ranges are intentionally vulnerable applications and websites that tempt players to steal money, view their boss’s salary, buy expensive items for free, and conduct other nefarious acts. Hundreds of vulnerabilities, common to most business applications, lay waiting.

For each vulnerability you find, you’ll get points added to your score and climb the live leaderboard. Top scorers get prizes, but all players have fun!

Worried you won’t know what to do?
Don’t worry. We’ll provide cheatsheets and tips to get you quickly ramped up.

Register online at: https://web.securityinnovation.com/owasp-okc

events.name: Auckland Training Day
events.description:
We'll be hosting a one-day training event, with two classes running concurrently.

We have access to both meeting spaces in Grid/AKL's Lysaght building - the Tech Cafe space can accommodate a class of up to 20 people, while the main meeting room can support a much larger class. The Call for Training opened on 15 July, and updated information will be posted here as it's available.

The registration fee is $150.00 per person (plus EventBrite fees). We're planning to provide tea breaks and lunch as part of the registration.

Registration will be through EventBrite.

Deep's voluntary roles include the President/Chair of the ISACA London Chapter.

Abstract :

Latest 2020 Verizon Data Breach Investigations Report (DBIR) was published a few days back. This comprehensive and free informative report - now in its 13th year - provides invaluable insight about cybercrime trends worldwide in a wide range of industries. One of the most respected publications in cybersecurity DBIR 2020, analyses over 150,000 incidents and provides a comprehensive report covering the incidents and breaches that met Verizon’s quality standards.
Many security leaders use the DBIR to sharpen the focus of their security efforts and to educate stakeholders who need to better understand real cyber risks.

In this session, Deepinder Chhabra (Deep) will present the key findings and highlights of the DBIR.

Provisional Agenda

18:45 - Webinar waiting lobby opens
19:00 - Presentation followed by Questions and Answers
20:00 - Closing, with virtual networking

https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/1574728658042752271

events.name: OWASP: CMD + CTRL Event!
events.description:
CMD+CTRL Cyber Range was a hit from our last year's event (https://www.meetup.com/OWASP-Las-Vegas-Chapter/events/263621436/) so we are doing this again!

OWASP Las Vegas and Security Innovation invite members to compete in the CMD+CTRL Cyber Range - intentionally vulnerable applications and websites that teach how to think like an attacker. Players have fun exploiting their way through hundreds of vulnerabilities while scoring points and moving up the leaderboard. Score at least 1,000 points, and you qualify for the gift raffle!

Want to start early? Prepare with courses, resources, success stories and a different
cyber range on Security Innovation’s Community Site.
Newbies - Join us to see how many vulnerabilities you can identify
Veterans - Come back to Shadow Bank and see what you missed

Register early to reserve your spot and get a sneak peek at our cheat sheets and FAQs! https://web.securityinnovation.com/owasp-las-vegas

events.name: Operationalizing OWASP SAMM for a Cloud Security Program
events.description: The security team at Snowflake used OWASP SAMM to improve both application and infrastructure security posture. A lot of effort and creativity went into applying the framework in a fast-growing operational environment. Securing Snowflake's cloud-native service also required us to cover cloud infrastructure elements that weren't obvious in the framework definition. In this talk, I will share from our experience, what worked and what didn't, and how analytics played a key role in measuring maturity with live data.

events.name: Test your skills on the CMD+CTRL Cyber Range
events.description:
Join your friends in the OWASP Oklahoma City chapter for a unique and challenging event featuring the CMD+CTRL Cyber Range on Thursday, August 27th starting at 4:00pm CT.

What is a Cyber Range?
CMD+CTRL Cyber Ranges are intentionally vulnerable applications and websites that tempt players to steal money, view their boss’s salary, buy expensive items for free, and conduct other nefarious acts. Hundreds of vulnerabilities, common to most business applications, lay waiting.

For each vulnerability you find, you’ll get points added to your score and climb the live leaderboard. Top scorers get prizes, but all players have fun!

Worried you won’t know what to do?
Don’t worry. We’ll provide cheatsheets and tips to get you quickly ramped up.

Register online at: https://web.securityinnovation.com/owasp-okc

events.name: Auckland Training Day
events.description:

We have access to both meeting spaces in Grid/AKL's Lysaght building - the Tech Cafe space can accommodate a class of up to 20 people, while the main meeting room can support a much larger class. The Call for Training opened on 15 July, and updated information will be posted here as it's available.

The registration fee is $150.00 per person (plus EventBrite fees). We're planning to provide tea breaks and lunch as part of the registration.

Registration will be through EventBrite.

events.name: ARU CSNRG, OWASP Cambs & BCS  "2020 Verizon Data Breach Investigations" Webinar
events.description:
Thursday 30th July 2020 18:45 – 20:45 - Online

Hosted by the Cyber Security & Networking Research Group, Anglia Ruskin University, OWASP (Open Web Application Security Project) Cambridge Chapter & BCS Cybercrime Forensics SG.

Background

OWASP (Open Web Application Security Project is a 501(c)(3) not-for-profit worldwide charitable organization focused on improving the security of application software. Their mission is to make application security visible, so that people and organizations can make informed decisions about true application security risks.

The Cyber Security and Networking (CSN) Research Group at Anglia Ruskin University has close working strategic relationships with industry, professional bodies, law enforcement, government agencies and academia in the delivery of operationally focused applied information and application security research. We have strong international links with professional organisations such as OWASP, BCS, ISC2, IISP & the UK Cyber Security Forum amongst others.

The BCS – Chartered Institute for IT - Cybercrime Forensics Special Interest Group (SG) promotes Cybercrime Forensics and the use of Cybercrime Forensics; of relevance to computing professionals, lawyers, law enforcement officers, academics and those interested in the use of Cybercrime Forensics and the need to address cybercrime for the benefit of those groups and of the wider public.

Speaker Biographies & Abstracts

Deepinder Chhabra, Head of Security Assurance (UK&I) with Verizon Business Group, "2020 Verizon Data Breach Investigations, Digital Shadows" .

Bio: Deepinder (Deep) is Head of Security Assurance (UK&I) with Verizon Business Group in the Security Consulting and Advisory Services.
He challenges, educates and engages senior stakeholders on many critical issues related to cybersecurity and the adoption of new disruptive technologies. He encourages innovative thinking to generate actionable strategies that help business thrive in a volatile, uncertain, complex and ambiguous (VUCA) world while managing their risks.
In a career spanning thirty years, Deep has worked with many of the FTSE 500 companies organisations.

Deep is an avid speaker and has addressed several conferences and events with wide-ranging topics on Cybersecurity, Cloud Security, DBIR, GDPR, Big Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence.

Deep holds a Post Graduate Diploma in Business Management. He has received Executive Education at Harvard Business School Executive and Cranfield University. He holds various industry qualifications including CCISO, CISA, CISM, CRISC, CGEIT, CISSP, ISO/IEC 27001 Lead Auditor.

He is currently pursuing Professional Doctorate in Data Science.
Deep's voluntary roles include the President/Chair of the ISACA London Chapter.

Abstract :

Latest 2020 Verizon Data Breach Investigations Report (DBIR) was published a few days back. This comprehensive and free informative report - now in its 13th year - provides invaluable insight about cybercrime trends worldwide in a wide range of industries. One of the most respected publications in cybersecurity DBIR 2020, analyses over 150,000 incidents and provides a comprehensive report covering the incidents and breaches that met Verizon’s quality standards.
Many security leaders use the DBIR to sharpen the focus of their security efforts and to educate stakeholders who need to better understand real cyber risks.

In this session, Deepinder Chhabra (Deep) will present the key findings and highlights of the DBIR.

Provisional Agenda

19:00 - Presentation followed by Questions and Answers
20:00 - Closing, with virtual networking

events.name: OWASP: CMD + CTRL Event!
events.description:
CMD+CTRL Cyber Range was a hit from our last year's event (https://www.meetup.com/OWASP-Las-Vegas-Chapter/events/263621436/) so we are doing this again!

OWASP Las Vegas and Security Innovation invite members to compete in the CMD+CTRL Cyber Range - intentionally vulnerable applications and websites that teach how to think like an attacker. Players have fun exploiting their way through hundreds of vulnerabilities while scoring points and moving up the leaderboard. Score at least 1,000 points, and you qualify for the gift raffle!

Want to start early? Prepare with courses, resources, success stories and a different
cyber range on Security Innovation’s Community Site.
Newbies - Join us to see how many vulnerabilities you can identify
Veterans - Come back to Shadow Bank and see what you missed

Register early to reserve your spot and get a sneak peek at our cheat sheets and FAQs! https://web.securityinnovation.com/owasp-las-vegas

events.name: Operationalizing OWASP SAMM for a Cloud Security Program
events.description: The security team at Snowflake used OWASP SAMM to improve both application and infrastructure security posture. A lot of effort and creativity went into applying the framework in a fast-growing operational environment. Securing Snowflake's cloud-native service also required us to cover cloud infrastructure elements that weren't obvious in the framework definition. In this talk, I will share from our experience, what worked and what didn't, and how analytics played a key role in measuring maturity with live data.

events.name: Test your skills on the CMD+CTRL Cyber Range
events.description:
Join your friends in the OWASP Oklahoma City chapter for a unique and challenging event featuring the CMD+CTRL Cyber Range on Thursday, August 27th starting at 4:00pm CT.

What is a Cyber Range?
CMD+CTRL Cyber Ranges are intentionally vulnerable applications and websites that tempt players to steal money, view their boss’s salary, buy expensive items for free, and conduct other nefarious acts. Hundreds of vulnerabilities, common to most business applications, lay waiting.

For each vulnerability you find, you’ll get points added to your score and climb the live leaderboard. Top scorers get prizes, but all players have fun!

Worried you won’t know what to do?
Don’t worry. We’ll provide cheatsheets and tips to get you quickly ramped up.

Register online at: https://web.securityinnovation.com/owasp-okc

events.name: Auckland Training Day
events.description:
We'll be hosting a one-day training event, with two classes running concurrently.

We have access to both meeting spaces in Grid/AKL's Lysaght building - the Tech Cafe space can accommodate a class of up to 20 people, while the main meeting room can support a much larger class. The Call for Training opened on 15 July, and updated information will be posted here as it's available.

The registration fee is $150.00 per person (plus EventBrite fees). We're planning to provide tea breaks and lunch as part of the registration.

Registration will be through EventBrite.
